title: Andrew Yang
added: In September 2021, Yang left the [[[[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]]. It was revealed that along with a new book ''Forward: Notes on the Future of Our Democracy'', he would be forming a [[Minor party|third party]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Thompson|first1=Alex|title=Andrew Yang to launch a third party|url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/09/09/andrew-yang-third-party-511033|access-date=9 September 2021 |date=9 September 2021}}</ref>

title: Andrew Yang
added: In Yang's 2021 book, ''Forward: Notes on the Future of Our Democracy'', he announced that he would be founding a new [[Third party (United States)|third party]], which would be named the Forward Party.<ref name="Forward">{{{Cite web|title=Andrew Yang's new 3rd party will be called 'The Forward Party,' according to his forthcoming book|url=https://www.businessinsider.com/andrew-yang-new-3rd-party-name-forward-party-book-2021-9|access-date=2021-09-23|website=[[Insider Inc.]]}}</ref> Yang founded the party under the premise that "Trust is fading ... Our political system is a fixed duopoly that will want to move slowly, if at all.".<ref name="Forward" /> The party's key principles include [[ranked-choice voting]], [[open primaries]], human-centered [[capitalism]] and [[universal basic income]].<ref name="Forward" />

title: Andrew Yang
added: On October 4, 2021, Andrew Yang announced that he would be leaving the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] and becoming an [[Independent politician|Independent]].<ref>{{Cite web|title=Breaking Up with the Democratic Party|url=https://www.andrewyang.com/blog/breaking-up-with-the-democratic-party|access-date=2021-10-04|website=Andrew Yang|language=en-US}}</ref>

title: Andrew Yang
added: On October 4, 2021, Andrew Yang announced that he would be leaving the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] and becoming an [[Independent politician|Independent]].<ref>{{Cite web|title=Breaking Up with the Democratic Party|url=https://www.andrewyang.com/blog/breaking-up-with-the-democratic-party|access-date=2021-10-04|website=Andrew Yang|language=en-US}}</ref>This coincided with his founding of the Forward Party.

title: Andrew Yang
added: On October 4, 2021, Yang made an announcement on his blog that had changed is voter registration from 'Democrat' to 'Independent', saying, it was "a strangely emotional experience". He also said that he is, "confident that no longer being a Democrat is the right thing".<ref>{{cite news |last=Gonzalez |first=Oriana |url=https://www.axios.com/andrew-yang-democrat-independent-voting-794f9190-ccdb-4af4-80b5-ec4df7884f88.html |title=Andrew Yang says he officially left the Democratic Party |work=[[Axios (website)]] |date=2021-10-04 |accessdate=2021-10-04 }}</ref>

title: Andrew Yang
added: On 6 October 2021, Yang announced that Wendy Hamilton, a Democrat running in the [[2022 United States House of Representatives election in District of Columbia|United States House of Representatives election in Washington, D.C.]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8xLFbTxeNy0|title=LIVE: Andrew Yang in Washington DC - October 6th 2021|date=October 6, 2021|accessdate=October 7, 2021|work=The Matt Skidmore Show}}</ref> {{efn| The District of Columbia is represented in Congress by a single non-voting delegate, elected [[At-large]], who sits in and is elected otherwise as, a member of the US House of Representatives}}, was the first candidate to be endorsed by the Forward Party. Hamilton is an ordained minister, who previously served as Director of Spiritual and Cultural Outreach for Yang's 2020 presidential campaign. <ref>{{cite web|title=D.C. Reverend announces candidacy for Congress|website=[[WDVM-TV|WDMV]]|date=February 3, 2021|url=https://www.localdvm.com/news/washington-dc/d-c-reverend-announces-candidacy-for-congress/|access-date=October 18, 2021}}</ref>
